result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

chargeModifiers.descr: Domestic Abuse - Infliction of Physical Pain or Injury

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Tefron Tarell Spivey

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Tefron Tarell Spivey in court.  Attorney Michael K. Moran in court for Tefron Tarell Spivey.  Prosecuting attorney Tristan J. Bednarek in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case set for a plea and sentencing hearing. For reasons stated on the record, parties request a scheduling conference. Case is adjourned to Br. 29.
Scheduling conference scheduled for November 17, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Case set for a plea and sentencing hearing. Branch 29 is in trial and unable to hear this matter. State requests an adjournment. Case rescheduled for a plea and sentencing hearing on 10/21/22 at 9:30 am. Parties notified.

Defendant Tefron Tarell Spivey in court with attorney Michael K. Moran.  Lisa M Valenti-Jordan appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Scheduling conference held. Defense counsel requests a plea and sentencing hearing.  Case is adjourned to Br. 29.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 23, 2022 at 10:30 am.

Defendant Tefron Tarell Spivey in court with attorney Michael K. Moran.  Lisa M Valenti-Jordan appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
Court conducted Indigency Hearing. Court held colloquy with defendant. Court found defendant is eligible for appointment of counsel by court. Defendant requested court appointed counsel and agreed to reimburse Milwaukee County for the expense. The court appointed Atty. Michael Moran, present in court, to represent defendant in this matter at County expense and at the rate of $100.00 per hour. The court ordered the defendant repay the County at a rate of $50.00 per month beginning at the completion of the case, and then the 1st of each month there after. Court advised defendant failure to pay will result in a civil judgment. Signed, Distributed & Filed, Order Appointing Attorney at County Expense. Case is adjourned to Br. 29.  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 30, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered no contact with LAM
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.
Court ordered Justice Point Pretrial Services LEVEL 2 SUPERVISION.  Court reminders.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Tefron Tarell Spivey in court with attorney Michael V Fuentes.  Defendant Tefron Tarell Spivey in custody.  Patrick T. Franken appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Tefron Tarell Spivey appeared by video means with Attorney.   Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Kiefer, Branch 29. Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant pled not guilty. DEFENDANT IS NOT INDIGENT.   This hearing may be streamed live at the discretion of the Court via https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/c105c3fe-89b8-5d05-5f8c-b6cf0d4921da  Indigency hearing scheduled for June 3, 2022 at 08:30 am.
